column1: n the case of Commission to Investigate Bribery or Corruption v. Maldeniyage Don
Upali Gunarathne Perera and others CA/CPA 77/2022 decided on 04.04.2023 it was
“… the decisions of the Commission cannot be questioned by any entity except
by  the  proper  action  at  the  proper  forum.  Such  proper  action  is  indicated  in
section 24(1) of the Act which states that ‘the jurisdiction vested in the Court of
Appeal  by  Article  140  of  the  Constitution  shall,  in  respect  of  applications  in
which relief is sought against the Commission be exercised by the Supreme Court
and not by the Court of Appeal.’”
